backend.getSelectValues.name: Backend\GetSelectValuesViewHelper
backend.getSelectValues.documentation:
ViewHelper to retrieve select values from a MultiColumnWizard configuration or a callable function.

This ViewHelper can either return the configuration array directly or call a specified method
to retrieve the select values dynamically.

.. caution::
   This ViewHelper can be used in the backend context only. 
   In all other context it will just return the configuration array.

Example usage:
--------------

.. code::
   :caption: Example ViewHelper usage

   <lia:getSelectValues configuration="{data.configuration}" optionsFunction="{data.function}" />

configuration.name: configuration
configuration.description: The json string of the MultiColumnWizard field.

optionsFunction.name: optionsFunction
optionsFunction.description: This array has to contain the full classname, the method to call and all the parameter that are needed to call this method.

getMultiColumnWizardValues.name: GetMultiColumnWizardValuesViewHelper
getMultiColumnWizardValues.documentation: ViewHelper for parsing the multicolumnwizard json string. Use this to prepare the data from a multicolumnwizard-field into an array. Examples ======== Field-data is found in: `data.multicolumnwizard` .. code-block:: html ` Content of `mcwArray`: .. code-block:: array(3) { 'field1' => 'value', 'field2' => 'value', 'field3' => 'value', } So it can be used like: .. code-block:: html {mcwArray.field1} Depending on the current value of `{data.multicolumnwizard}` and the `associative` argument.

associative.name: associative
associative.description: If the array should be associative

isEmpty.name: IsEmptyViewHelper
isEmpty.documentation:
Check if the given MultiColumnWizard field has any values.
Checks every field in every row and returns true if every value is empty.

Examples
========

Usage in a condition like this:

.. code-block:: html

   <f:if condition="!{mcw:isEmpty(json: data.tx_lia_multicolumnwizard)}">
       <!-- Your content -->
   </f:if>
